Description: Shoulder sherd of Attic black-figured pottery oinochoe type III; exterior: short tongues pendent from narrow black band at neck and shoulder junction; below at left, two vertical black bands, framing the remains of the vertical decoration of zig-zag to the left of the panel; black-figure decoration consisting of Dionysos to right (part of robe, back of head, beard, and ivy wreath in hair and tied into krobylos remaining); above figure's head, part of vine branch.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The short tongues at the neck, as well as the vine branches are common in works by the Gela Painter. For parallels, see British Museum 1842,0728.787 and A128 (22457) from the Museo Archeologico Nazionale in Adria.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 313-4, no. B332)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0322) (Phase 1)
